content:
• Friday, August 12, 2011
  • LGF.A

    Carl Icahn purchases an additional 703K shares of Lions Gate Entertainment (LGF), bringing his...

    Carl Icahn purchases an additional 703K shares of Lions Gate Entertainment (LGF), bringing his total to 45.5M shares. Shares +1.7% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:54 PM | 1 Comment
  • MCPIQ

    Molycorp (MCP) closed the day up 8.8%, following a strong Q2 report and a new supply agreement...

    Molycorp (MCP) closed the day up 8.8%, following a strong Q2 report and a new supply agreement with Hitachi Metals. Other rare earth miners moved higher in sympathy: AVL +8.5%. REE +5.5%. SHZ +7.3%. (PR) (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM
  • FRF

    Fortegra Financial (FRF -22.7%) plummets today after its Q2 scores a big miss on EPS...

    Fortegra Financial (FRF -22.7%) plummets today after its Q2 scores a big miss on EPS expectations due to a significant jump in acquisition and operating costs.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM
  • JBHT

    Trucking stocks are up 3% as lower oil prices look set to help firms' boost margins, offsetting...

    Trucking stocks are up 3% as lower oil prices look set to help firms' boost margins, offsetting to a degree concerns on the U.S. economy. Gainers: JBHT +3.4%, ODFL +5%, ABFS +4.3%, CNW +3.9%, SWFT +7.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM
  • TXCCQ

    TranSwitch (TXCC +17%) is soaring today, after announcing earlier its HDMI 1.4 Intellectual...

    TranSwitch (TXCC +17%) is soaring today, after announcing earlier its HDMI 1.4 Intellectual Property with patented Phaswitch technology has been selected by Samsung Electronics (OTC:SSNLF) for its next generation of televisions.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:34 PM
  • GS

    Bank stocks (XLF -0.9%) fail to hold early gains, as Rochdale's Dick Bove observes that short...

    Bank stocks (XLF -0.9%) fail to hold early gains, as Rochdale's Dick Bove observes that short sellers are finding U.S. targets after European opportunities are denied, adding that he believes Goldman Sachs (GS -2.1%) and Morgan Stanley (MS -5.8%) are being particularly targeted. Other losers: RF -4.4%, FITB -3.5%, JPM -2.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:31 PM
  • QTM-OLD

    Quantum (QTM-OLD +9%) extends its two-day rally after SEC filings show CEO Jon Gacek recently...

    Quantum (QTM-OLD +9%) extends its two-day rally after SEC filings show CEO Jon Gacek recently bought 25K shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM
  • REGN

    Shares of Regeneron Pharmaceuticals (REGN +7.9%) pop on heavy volume after an analyst report...

    Shares of Regeneron Pharmaceuticals (REGN +7.9%) pop on heavy volume after an analyst report from Roth Capital gains traction. The firm upgrades shares to Buy on its belief the drugmaker has an improved pipeline, and is close to FDA approval on several key drug treatments.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:09 PM
  • EXM

    Shares of Excel Maritime (EXM -4.3%) lag behind other shipping stocks (SEA -0.2%) after Zachs...

    Shares of Excel Maritime (EXM -4.3%) lag behind other shipping stocks (SEA -0.2%) after Zachs downgrades the firm to Underperform citing intense price competition likely to hit margins. The sector still sits down 40% over the last year, although one trader finds a reason to buy.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:30 PM
  • MAKO

    MAKO Surgical (MAKO +12.2%) continues to gain on the back of a solid earnings Q2 report on...

    MAKO Surgical (MAKO +12.2%) continues to gain on the back of a solid earnings Q2 report on Tuesday, after the company recorded an 81% leap in revenues Y/Y and a significant expansion of its intellectual property portfolio.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:18 PM | 1 Comment
  • XCO

    Reports on insider buying (I, II, III) continue to pile in as execs with confidence in their...

    Reports on insider buying (I, II, III) continue to pile in as execs with confidence in their firms bottom-dip, but not every insider is a buyer this week. Firms with the largest insider selling: XCO, AMCX, TPC, HF, PCLN.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM
  • BTE

    Canadian Oil and Gas driller Baytex Energy (BTE +6.5%) trades higher on a Toronto Dominion...

    Canadian Oil and Gas driller Baytex Energy (BTE +6.5%) trades higher on a Toronto Dominion upgrade, after the company reported earnings on Thursday that nearly doubled analysts' estimates.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM
  • GT

    Goodyear Tire (GT +8.7%) paces all S&P stocks after CFO Darren Wells said yesterday the...

    Goodyear Tire (GT +8.7%) paces all S&P stocks after CFO Darren Wells said yesterday the company now anticipates offsetting much of its raw material costs in Q3, raising the prospect of its first profitable full year since 2007. Goodyear has been able to pass on some of its increased costs to customers through tire price hikes and sales of higher-end tires.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:39 PM | 1 Comment
  • BA

    The WSJ's MarketBeat blog notes "economically sensitive" stocks such as Boeing (BA +4.3%),...

    The WSJ's MarketBeat blog notes "economically sensitive" stocks such as Boeing (BA +4.3%), Caterpillar (CAT +3.4%), and Disney (DIS +3.3%) are outperforming today, a sign recession fears may be ebbing. Other recession-sensitive names moving higher: MGM +5.2%. WYNN +4.1%. HON +3.4%. LULU +7.5%. URBN +5.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:38 PM
  • AMCC

    Applied Micro Circuits (AMCC +5.7%) gains after Wunderlich initiates the shares with a buy on...

    Applied Micro Circuits (AMCC +5.7%) gains after Wunderlich initiates the shares with a buy on valuation, saying the new CEO has positioned the company on a "sustainable revenue growth path despite near-term headwinds the company has been facing."
     
     
     
     
    | 1:28 PM
  • DDS

    S&P piles on Dillard's (DDS -16.7%) with a downgrade to Hold from Buy after the firm's...

    S&P piles on Dillard's (DDS -16.7%) with a downgrade to Hold from Buy after the firm's disappointing Q2 report highlights near-term challenges. The ratings agency lowers its price target to $46, from $66, a level that still offers a 15% premium on shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:19 PM
  • HPQ

    Hewlett-Packard (HPQ +3.5%) is “well-positioned for the transition to the cloud,”...

    Hewlett-Packard (HPQ +3.5%) is “well-positioned for the transition to the cloud,” Jefferies' Peter Misek writes, upgrading the stock to Buy despite the possibility of slightly missing its numbers when it reports next Tuesday. Misek thinks H-P will enjoy improved operating margins in coming years based on having the "components of a full [cloud] stack." (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:18 PM | 1 Comment
  • GLBR

    FXCM +17% after reporting a Q2 profit of $0.21/share, beating expectations by a penny. CEO Drew...

    FXCM +17% after reporting a Q2 profit of $0.21/share, beating expectations by a penny. CEO Drew Niv says the company has and will continue to benefit from heightened volatility in currency markets. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM
  • NWL

    Newell Rubbermaid (NWL +5%) continues to grind higher after announcing a $300M stock repurchase...

    Newell Rubbermaid (NWL +5%) continues to grind higher after announcing a $300M stock repurchase program earlier today.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM
  • LHO

    Jefferies is out with a cautious note on the hotel space due to the recent market volatility....

    Jefferies is out with a cautious note on the hotel space due to the recent market volatility. The firm ratchets down estimates and downgrades five companies: LaSalle Hotel Properties (LHO -1%), Host Hotels (HST -1.9%), Gaylord Entertainment (GET +0.8%) and Starwood Hotels & Resorts (HOT -1.7%) are all cut to hold, and Orient-Express (OEH -5.7%) is reduced to underperform.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM
  • AZO

    Oppenheimer sees shares of AutoZone (AZO +1.2%) moving higher, setting a $332 price target (+17%...

    Oppenheimer sees shares of AutoZone (AZO +1.2%) moving higher, setting a $332 price target (+17% premium) and upgrading the firm to Outperform from Perform. A Citi analyst concurs, calling for a $326 price target for the firm as the best positioned in its industry with an aggressive share repurchasement program to boot.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM
  • FFIV

    F5 Networks (FFIV +7%) jumps after William Blair ups the stock to outperform, saying it's "too...

    F5 Networks (FFIV +7%) jumps after William Blair ups the stock to outperform, saying it's "too inexpensive to pass up". The firm notes the company's strong competitive position and history of successfully navigating downturns.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • PTX

    Permix Therapeutics (PTX +5.7%) trades higher this morning after being initiated with a buy at...

    Permix Therapeutics (PTX +5.7%) trades higher this morning after being initiated with a buy at Stifel Nicolaus. The firm says its "a classic growth story," with a "proven acquistition strategy to fuel expansion."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM
  • SHP

    Chinese biotech research firm ShangPharma (SHP +18.3%) pops after announcing a $10M stock...

    Chinese biotech research firm ShangPharma (SHP +18.3%) pops after announcing a $10M stock repurchase program. In addition, founder and CEO Michael Xin Hui intends to purchase up to $1M worth of its shares through a personal, family-owned company.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM
  • TSLA

    A video rumored to be released back-channels by Tesla Motors (TSLA +3.3%) emerges on YouTube...

    A video rumored to be released back-channels by Tesla Motors (TSLA +3.3%) emerges on YouTube shows the all-electric 2012 Model S driving along smartly with the 2011 Roadster. Shares of TSLA have ignored the market chaos and are up 10% for the week.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • GLD

    Gold continues to slide, off about $100/oz. over the last 36 hours as world equities have...

    Gold continues to slide, off about $100/oz. over the last 36 hours as world equities have regained their footing amidst short-selling bans, currency interventions, and hints of QE. The metal remains nearly 7% higher for the month, beating shares by just a bit. GLD -1.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM | 3 Comments
  • DDS

    Shares of Dillard's (DDS -17.5%) implode following its earnings report issued last night....

    Shares of Dillard's (DDS -17.5%) implode following its earnings report issued last night. Investors are skipping over the EPS beat and focusing instead on the questionable ability of the firm to increase margins with growth stalling.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM
  • BYI

    Bally Technologies' (BYI -13.8%) F4Q beats expectations on a 9% Y/Y gain in revenue, but the...

    Bally Technologies' (BYI -13.8%) F4Q beats expectations on a 9% Y/Y gain in revenue, but the stock is lower today after the company failed to issue clear FY12 guidance due to the current market volatility. Separately, JPMorgan downgrades to neutral.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM
  • AL

    Shares of Air Lease (AL +5.5%) soar after the firm reports Q2 revenue of $74M (+35% Y/Y) and...

    Shares of Air Lease (AL +5.5%) soar after the firm reports Q2 revenue of $74M (+35% Y/Y) and beats EPS estimates by $0.02. FBR Capital upgrades the firm to Outperfom and raises its full-year EPS estimate to $0.49 from $0.38.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM
  • AONEQ

    Electric car battery developer A123 Systems (AONE), which took off yesterday on a supply deal...

    Electric car battery developer A123 Systems (AONE), which took off yesterday on a supply deal with GM, is down 7.3% today as Goldman's Mark Wienkes downgrades shares to Neutral and lowers his PT to $5. Wienkes remains concerned about A123's long-term profitability, which he thinks the GM deal doesn't affect.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM | 2 Comments
  • BUD

    Shares of Anheuser-Busch Inbev (BUD +5.8%) rally again as investors start to warm up to the...

    Shares of Anheuser-Busch Inbev (BUD +5.8%) rally again as investors start to warm up to the brewer's growth prospects. CEO Carlos Brito says the NFL season will be a springboard for the Bud Light line to gain market share, and the firm will soon start a TV and digital campaign on top of its $50M NFL sponsorship.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM
  • CAT

    Caterpillar (CAT +3.5%) leads the Dow higher after shares start to pick up more steam following...

    Caterpillar (CAT +3.5%) leads the Dow higher after shares start to pick up more steam following reports the firm expects its rail market to improve in 2012. The industry could be a potential growth target for CAT, as the firm sits on $52B of cash based on the firm's last report to investors.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM
  • TIVO

    TiVo (TIVO +4.6%) is moving higher after its board authorizes a $100M stock repurchase plan -...

    TiVo (TIVO +4.6%) is moving higher after its board authorizes a $100M stock repurchase plan - that's equal to 10.4% of the company's current market cap. TiVo's brand and patent portfolio have made it the subject of takeover chatter for a long time.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:53 AM
  • BAC

    Big banks (XLF +1.6%) open higher, putting them on track for their first consecutive days of...

    Big banks (XLF +1.6%) open higher, putting them on track for their first consecutive days of gains in several sessions. Gains in European banks lent support to U.S. shares as investors overseas snapped up some beaten-down financials. BAC +3.8%, C +3.3%, WFC +2.6%, JPM +1.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM
  • DDS

    Department store chain and construction company Dillard's (NYSE:DDS), whose shares had surged...

    Department store chain and construction company Dillard's (NYSE:DDS), whose shares had surged over the last 12 months, is down 12.1% premarket after reporting Q2 revenue of $1.44B (+4% Y/Y) and EPS (exc. one-time gains) of $0.25, compared with a consensus of $1.42B and $0.25. Same-store sales rose 6% Y/Y, and $250M in shares were repurchased.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM

  • European shares are in full melt-up mode, the Stoxx 50 (FEZ) at its high of the day, +4.2%....

    European shares are in full melt-up mode, the Stoxx 50 (FEZ) at its high of the day, +4.2%. Italy (EWI) is the biggest gainer, +5.2%. The short-selling ban looks to have won the day, for the moment. European indices are about 10% higher since the idea was floated about 24 hours ago.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:19 AM | 12 Comments
  • SNE

    Shares of Logitech 6.4% higher premarket after the stock has taken a beating over the last two...

    Shares of Logitech 6.4% higher premarket after the stock has taken a beating over the last two months as it was caught up in a price war with Sony (NYSE:SNE) in the Google (NASDAQ:GOOG) TV-powered HDTV market. Weak demand for the products has caused the firms to slash prices.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:03 AM
  • MNKD

    Premarket gainers: MNKD +12%. NVDA +12%. MCP +9%. SODA +7%. AVL +7%. ALU +6%. AIB +6%. BUD +6%....

    Premarket gainers: MNKD +12%. NVDA +12%. MCP +9%. SODA +7%. AVL +7%. ALU +6%. AIB +6%. BUD +6%. NOK +5%. E +4%. BCS +4%. LYG +4%. FFIV +4%. CAT +4%. MGM +4%. SD +3%. SNY +4%. ING +3%. BAC +3%. AMR +3%. RIO +3%. STD +3%. UL +3%. UBS +3%. TEF +3%. RIG +3%.
    Losers: FRF -17%. MOBI -15%. DDS -10%. AONE -5%. AU -3%. JCP -3%. GFI -3%. RENN -4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • MDS

    Midas (NYSE:MDS) +23.9% premarket after the auto repair and services company announced after...

    Midas (NYSE:MDS) +23.9% premarket after the auto repair and services company announced after yesterday's close that it is exploring strategic alternatives including a possible sale, merger or other business combination.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:54 AM
  • MNKD

    MannKind (NASDAQ:MNKD) +16% premarket after the biotech company confirms with the FDA the design...

    MannKind (NASDAQ:MNKD) +16% premarket after the biotech company confirms with the FDA the design of two clinical studies that evaluate the efficacy and safety of Afrezza, an inhaled insulin drug considered crucial for the company. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:44 AM
  • NVDA

    Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) is up 11.3% premarket after reporting Q2 results and Q3 guidance that...

    Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) is up 11.3% premarket after reporting Q2 results and Q3 guidance that soothed investors worried about weak PC sales and share losses to Intel's (NASDAQ:INTC) Sandy Bridge platform. Roth Capital is reiterating a Buy, believing growth will accelerate as Nvidia's high-performance Tegra 3 chip for smartphones and tablets ramps. (PR) (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:12 AM
  • MCPIQ

    Piper Jaffray reiterates its Overweight rating on Molycorp (MCP) with a $77 price target. The...

    Piper Jaffray reiterates its Overweight rating on Molycorp (MCP) with a $77 price target. The firm sees rare earth prices and tightening Chinese exports as drivers to help the producer boost gross margins. Shares +8.8% premarket, riding a post-earnings beat wave.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:47 AM
